alert.note: Alert for ASZ003; Manua; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Hurricane Local Statement issued April 21 at 6:09PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...HURRICANE AMOS CONTINUES TO STRENGTHEN AND MOVING TOWARD THE SAMOAN ISLANDS... ...NEW INFORMATION... TROPICAL CYCLONE AMOS UPGRADED TO HURRICANE STRENGTH ...AREAS AFFECTED... THIS LOCAL STATEMENT PROVIDES INFORMATION FOR TUTUILA...AUNUU...MANU`A AND SWAINS. ...WATCHES/WARNINGS... A HIGH SURF WARNING IS IN EFFECT FOR ALL AMERICAN SAMOA. A TROPICAL STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL AMERICAN SAMOA. A FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL AMERICAN SAMOA. ...STORM INFORMATION... AT 4:30 PM LOCAL TIME THURSDAY...HURRICANE AMOS WAS CENTERED NEAR LATITUDE 12.7 SOUTH...LONGITUDE 177.0 WEST...OR ABOUT 380 NAUTICAL MILES WEST OF TUTUILA. TROPICAL CYCLONE AMOS HAS MOVED EAST-SOUTHEAST AROUND 9 MPH. MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS ARE NEAR 75 MPH. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE...THE NEXT LOCAL STATEMENT WILL BE ISSUED AROUND 12 AM LOCAL TIME FRIDAY...OR SOONER IF CONDITIONS WARRANT. ...A HIGH SURF WARNING IS IN EFFECT... ...A TROPICAL STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT... ...A FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT... ...WINDS... ON TUTUILA...AUNUU AND SWAINS...TROPICAL STORM FORCE WINDS OF 45 TO 50 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS WILL ARRIVE AFTER FRIDAY MIDNIGHT. ON MANU`A...NORTH WINDS OF 25 TO 35 MPH WILL INCREASE TO 40 TO 45 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. ...STORM SURGE AND STORM TIDES... HAZARDOUS SURFS GENERATED FROM TROPICAL CYCLONE AMOS WILL ARRIVE ALONG THE SOUTHWEST...WEST...NORTHWEST AND NORTH FACING REEFS OF ALL AMERICAN SAMOA STARTING FRIDAY AFTERNOON THAN PEAKING TO NEAR 26 FEET SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. STORM SURGE OF 3 TO 5 FEET WILL IMPACT THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES ESPECIALLY DURING HIGH TIDES OVER THE WEEKEND. && LAPATAIGA MO MATAGI MALOLOSI OFISA O LE TAU PAGO PAGO AS 609 PM AFIAFI ASO TOFI APERILA 21 2016 ...FAAMATALAGA FOU... UA AVEA NEI AMOS MA AFA ...NOFOAGA UA AAFIA... O LE A MAFAI ONA AAFIA MOTU UMA O AMERIKA SAMOA...TUTUILA...AUNUU...MANU`A MA SWAINS. ...NOFO VAAVAAIA/LAPATAIGA... UA IAI NEI SE LAPATAIGA MO GALU MAUALULUGA O LOO TUMAU LE NOFO VA`AVAAIA MO MATAGI MALOLOSI O AMERIKA SAMOA. O LOO TUMAU PEA LE NOFO VAAVAAIA MO TAFEGA MA LOLOGA MO AMERIKA SAMOA. ...FAAMATALAGA E FAATATAU I TULAGA LOULOUA O LE TAU... I LE AFA O LE 4 I LE AFIAFI O LE ASO...SA IAI LE AFA O AMOS E TUSA MA LE 380 MAILA TAUTAI LE MAMAO I SISIFO O TUTUILA...MA O LOO AGA`I LEMU I SASA`E-SAUTE I SASA`E E TUSA MA LE 9 MAILA I LE ITULA LE SAOASAOA. O LE MALOLOSI O LE AFA O AMOS UA OO ATU I LE 75 MPH. FAUTUAGA/TAPENAGA... FAAMOLEMOLE TAGA`I ANE I AU TAPENAGA MA SAUNIUNIGA TUSI-TUSIA MO FAALAVELAVE FAAFUASE`I...MA SAUNI E FAATINO PE A IAI NI LAPATAIGA. FAAFOFOGA MAI PEA MO NI TALA FOU MAI LE OFISA O LE VAAI-TAU MA LE OFISA O LE EOC PO O LE TEMCO. MO TAUTAI O VA`A...UA TATAU ONA FO`I I LE TAULAGA...AUA LE SAOGALEMU O VA`A MA MEA TOTINO. IA TAPENA MO FALAVELAVE FAAFUASE`I I TAIMI O MATAGI MALOLOSI MA TULAGA LOULOUA O LE TAU. IA FAAFOFOGA MAI PEA I TALA O LE TAU AE MAISE FAAALIGA MAI OFISA O LE MALO. O TIMUGA MAMAFA MA LE MALOLOSI O TAFEGA E MAFAI ONA FAATUPULAIA AI LOLOGA I NOFOAGA MAUALALO MA AUALA-TELE. FAAMOLEMOLE IA FAAETEETE I TAIMI O FEMALAGAIGA AE MAISE NOFOAGA E LATA I MAUGA ONA O LE SUSU O LE ELEELE UA IAI NEI. MO NI ISI FAAMATALAGA MO TAPENAGA...FAAMOLEMOLE FAAFESOOTA`I ANE LE EOC I LE 699-3800. ...MATAGI... MO TUTUILA...AUNUU MA SWAINS...O LE A TAUNUU MAI MATAGI MALOLOSI O AMOS I LE VAELUAGA O LE PO O LE ASO FARAILE...MA O LE A MAFAI ONA OO ATU I LE 45 I LE 50 MPH MA E AGI FAATA`UTA`U I NI ISI O TAIMI. MO MANU`A...O SAVILI MAI MATU E 25 I LE 35 MPH O LE A SIISII ATU I LE 40 I LE 45 MPH MA E AGI FAATA`UTA`U I LE VAVEAO O LE ASO TOONA`I. ...GALU MAUALULUGA MA TULAGA O LE TAI... O LE A MAFAI ONA AAFIA GATAIFALE I SAUTE I SISIFO...SISIFO...MATU I SISIFO MA MATU O AMERIKA SAMOA E AMATA ATU I LE AOAULI O LE ASO FARAILE SEIA OO INA SIISII LE MAUALULUGA O GALU E LATA I LE 26 FUTU I LE ASO TOONA`I MA LE ASO SA. O LE A MAFAI FO`I ONA OO MAI GALU E LATA I LE 3 I LE 5 FUTU LE MAUALULUGA I UTA O AUALA MA O LE A AAFIA AI NOFOAGA TU-LATA I MATAFAGA. ...MO NISI RIPOTI FOU... O LE A TOE AUINA ATU SE RIPOTI FOU I LE 12 I LE VAELUAGA O LE PO ASO TOFI...PE VAVE ATU FO`I PE A IAI NI SUIGA.
info.instruction: REVIEW YOUR TROPICAL CYCLONES DISASTER PLAN AND BE READY TO ACT IF A TROPICAL STORM WARNING IS ISSUED. LISTEN FOR THE LATEST INFORMATION FROM YOUR LOCAL NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE OFFICE AND EMERGENCY OPERATION CENTER (EOC) OR TEMCO. MARINERS SHOULD MAKE ALL NECESSARY PREPARATIONS TO RETURN TO PORT...SEEK SAFE HARBOR...AND SECURE THEIR CRAFT. INITIATE PREPARATIONS ACCORDING TO YOUR EMERGENCY PLAN FOR TROPICAL CYCLONES. MONITOR NOAA WEATHER RADIO FOR CHANGES TO THE LATEST FORECAST AND LISTEN FOR FURTHER STATEMENTS FROM LOCAL OFFICES. HEAVY RAINFALL AND RUNOFFS MAY CAUSE SMALL STREAMS TO OVERFLOW... RESULTING IN FLOODING OF LOW LYING AREAS AND ROADWAYS. PLEASE TAKE EXTRA CAUTION WHEN DRIVING THROUGH FLOOD ROADS. MUD AND LANDSLIDES ARE ALSO POSSIBLE ALONG STEEP SLOPES AND MOUNTAINOUS AREAS AS GROUNDS BECOME SATURATED. FOR ADDITIONAL PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT THE EOC AT 699-3800.
